headline: Trade Desk price target lowered to $83 from $133 at Scotiabank
summary: Scotiabank lowered the firm’s price target on Trade Desk (TTD) to $83 from $133 and keeps a Sector Perform rating on the shares. The company posted its first revenue miss in public market history, the analyst tells investors. The company has faced worsening investor sentiment to start 2025 and these results will likely fuel negative investor concerns, the firm adds. Published first on TheFly – the ultimate source for real-time, market-moving breaking financial news. Try Now>> See today’s best-pe

headline: Trade Desk price target lowered to $130 from $155 at Truist
summary: Truist analyst Youssef Squali lowered the firm’s price target on Trade Desk (TTD) to $130 from $155 but keeps a Buy rating on the shares. The company reported a slight Q4 miss and a guide-down for Q1 that was driven by execution missteps amid an otherwise healthy ad environment and several secular growth drivers, the analyst tells investors in a research note. Slower Kokai deployment and changes across client-facing and engineering personnel drove much of the top line slowdown, but this trend ha

headline: Trade Desk price target lowered to $122 from $144 at Stifel
summary: Stifel lowered the firm’s price target on Trade Desk (TTD) to $122 from $144 and keeps a Buy rating on the shares. In Q4, Trade Desk “missed for the first time as a public company (excluding 1Q20),” and guided below the Street for Q1, the analyst tells investors. A miss at “some point was inevitable,” contends the firm, which adds that the “hiccup” does not change its thesis that Trade Desk is “best positioned in CTV.” Published first on TheFly – the ultimate source for real-time, market-moving
